import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]

lemma closure_diff_subset_closure_diff (A B : Set X) : closure A \ closure B ‚äÜ closure (A \ B) := by sorry

args.query: closure_union closure A union B topological space

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]

theorem closure_union (A B : Set X) : closure (A ‚à™ B) = closure A ‚à™ closure B := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]

/-!
Note on correctness:
The statement "closure (A ‚à© U) ‚äÜ closure A ‚à© U for open U" is false in general.
For a counterexample, take X = ‚Ñù, A = ‚Ñö (rationals), and U = (0,1).  Then A ‚à© U is dense in [0,1],
so its closure contains the endpoints 0 and 1, which need not lie in U.  Thus
closure (A ‚à© U) ‚äÑ U in general.

Below are two correct related statements:
  * closure (A ‚à© U) ‚äÜ closure A ‚à© closure U for any A, U ‚äÜ X;
  * if C is closed, then closure (A ‚à© C) ‚äÜ closure A ‚à© C.
-/

theorem closure_inter_subset_closure_inter_closure {A U : Set X} :
  Set.closure (A ‚à© U) ‚äÜ Set.closure A ‚à© Set.closure U := by
  sorry

theorem closure_inter_subset_closure_inter_of_closed {A C : Set X} (hC : IsClosed C) :
  Set.closure (A ‚à© C) ‚äÜ Set.closure A ‚à© C := by
  sorry
